pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:0.5.eng: The training rule on reviling the community

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī bhaṇḍanakārikā hoti kalahakārikā vivādakārikā bhassakārikā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārikā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī was quarrelsome and argumentative, and she created legal issues in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.3.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī tassā kamme karīyamāne paṭikkosati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.3.eng: But when a legal procedure was being done against her, the nun Thullanandā objected.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī gāmakaṃ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.4.eng: Soon afterwards when Thullanandā went to a village on some business,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.6.pli: “thullanandā bhikkhunī pakkantā”ti caṇḍakāḷiṃ bhikkhuniṃ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.6.eng: took the opportunity to eject Caṇḍakāḷī for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.7.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī gāmake taṃ karaṇīyaṃ tīretvā punadeva sāvatthiṃ paccāgacchi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.7.eng: When Thullanandā had finished her business, she returned to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.8.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā āgacchantiyā neva āsanaṃ paññapesi na pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakaṭhalikaṃ upanikkhipi;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.8.eng: As she was approaching, Caṇḍakāḷī neither prepared a seat for her, nor set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, or water for washing the feet;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.9.pli: na paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi na pānīyena āpucchi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.9.eng: and she did not go out to meet her to receive her bowl and robe or to ask whether she wanted water to drink.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.11.pli: “kissa tvaṃ, ayye, mayi āgacchantiyā neva āsanaṃ paññapesi na pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakaṭhalikaṃ upanikkhipi;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.11.eng: why she was acting like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.12.pli: na paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi na pānīyena āpucchī”ti?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.13.eng: She replied, “That’s how it is, Venerable, when one doesn’t have a protector.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.14.eng: “But how is it, Venerable, that you don’t have a protector?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.16.pli: ‘ayaṃ anāthā appaññātā, natthi imissā kāci pativattā’ti, āpattiyā adassane ukkhipiṃsū”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.16.eng: that no one would speak up for me because I am not esteemed by them and I didn’t have a protector, they ejected me for not recognizing an offense.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.18.pli: “bālā etā abyattā etā netā jānanti kammaṃ vā kammadosaṃ vā kammavipattiṃ vā kammasampattiṃ vā”ti, caṇḍīkatā gaṇaṃ paribhāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.18.eng: “They are incompetent fools! They don’t understand legal procedures, nor what makes them fail or succeed.” And being furious, she reviled the community.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.18.comm: In this case gaṇa seems to stand for the Sangha that did the legal procedure against Caṇḍakāḷī. See also the definition of gaṇa below.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.19.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.19.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.20.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā caṇḍīkatā gaṇaṃ paribhāsissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.20.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā revile the community because she is furious?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.21.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī caṇḍīkatā gaṇaṃ paribhāsatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.21.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.24.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī caṇḍīkatā gaṇaṃ paribhāsissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.24.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.26.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.26.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.27.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī caṇḍīkatā gaṇaṃ paribhāseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:1.27.1.eng: ‘If a furious nun reviles the community, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.8.eng: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.10.pli: “bālā etā abyattā etā netā jānanti kammaṃ vā kammadosaṃ vā kammavipattiṃ vā kammasampattiṃ vā”ti paribhāsati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.10.eng: if she reviles them, saying, “They are incompetent fools. They don’t understand legal procedures, nor what makes them fail or succeed,” she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.11.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo vā ekaṃ bhikkhuniṃ vā anupasampannaṃ vā paribhāsati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.11.eng: If she reviles several nuns, a single nun, or someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.11.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “several” for sambahula, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.13.eng: if she is aiming at something beneficial;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.14.eng: if she is aiming at giving a teaching;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.15.eng: if she is aiming at giving an instruction;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.17.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:2.18.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro brāhmaṇo bhikkhuniyo nimantetvā bhojesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.2.eng: a certain brahmin had invited the nuns for a meal.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.3.pli: Bhikkhuniyo bhuttāvī pavāritā ñātikulāni gantvā ekaccā bhuñjiṃsu ekaccā piṇḍapātaṃ ādāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.3.eng: When the nuns had finished and refused an invitation to eat more, they went to their respective families, where some ate and others got almsfood and left.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.4.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo paṭivissake etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.4.eng: Soon afterwards that brahmin said this to his neighbors,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.5.pli: “bhikkhuniyo mayā, ayyā, santappitā, etha tumhepi santappessāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.5.eng: “I have satisfied the nuns. Come, and I’ll satisfy you, too.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.8.pli: Yāpi tayā nimantitā tāpi amhākaṃ gharāni āgantvā ekaccā bhuñjiṃsu ekaccā piṇḍapātaṃ ādāya agamaṃsū”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.8.eng: Those nuns who were invited by you came to our houses, where some ate and others got almsfood and left.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.9.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.9.eng: That brahmin complained and criticized those nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo amhākaṃ ghare bhuñjitvā aññatra bhuñjissanti, na cāhaṃ paṭibalo yāvadatthaṃ dātun”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.10.eng: “How could they eat in our house and afterwards eat elsewhere? Am I not able to give them as much as they want?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.11.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tassa brāhmaṇassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.11.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of that brahmin,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.12.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.12.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo bhuttāvī pavāritā aññatra bhuñjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.13.eng: “How could nuns finish their meal, refuse an invitation to eat more, and then eat elsewhere?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo bhuttāvī pavāritā aññatra bhuñjantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.14.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.17.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo bhuttāvī pavāritā aññatra bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.17.eng: “How could nuns act in this way?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.19.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.20.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī nimantitā vā pavāritā vā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.20.1.eng: ‘If a nun, who has been invited to a meal, refuses an invitation to eat more, and then eats fresh or cooked food, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.20.1.comm: “Refuses an offer to eat more” renders pavārita. I normally translate both nimantita and pavārita as “invited”. Yet this becomes awkward on the rare occasions, such as here, when the two words occur together, and so in this instance I instead use the verb “offer” for pavārita. Moreover, in the present case, the contextual meaning of pavārita is that the nun has expressed her satisfaction after being invited to take more, thus my rendering. See the discussion of this rule in Appendix on Individual Bhikkhunī Rules. For further discussion of pavārita/pavāraṇā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.5.eng: Refuses an offer to eat more:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.6.eng: refuses an offer to eat any of the five cooked foods.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.7.eng: Refuses an invitation to eat more:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.8.pli: asanaṃ paññāyati, bhojanaṃ paññāyati, hatthapāse ṭhitā abhiharati, paṭikkhepo paññāyati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.8.eng: eating is seen, cooked food is seen, it is brought forward within arm’s reach, a refusal is seen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.8.comm: As with Bu Pc 35:3.1.8 and Bu Pc 36:2.1.10, the punctuation of the Pali is wrong. An additional comma is required between ṭhito and abhiharati. “They” refers to the donor, whether male or female.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.10.pli: pañca bhojanāni yāguṃ yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ ṭhapetvā
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.10.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, congee, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.13.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.13.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.13.comm: “Cooked food” renders bhojanīya. See discussion of this word in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.14.eng: If she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.15.eng: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.1.pli: Nimantite nimantitasaññā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.1.eng: If she has refused an offer, and she perceives that she has, and she eats fresh or cooked food, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.1.comm: The non-offense clause below states that there is no offense if one has been invited but has not refused an offer to eat more. In other words, there is only an offense if both of these factors are fulfilled. I therefore take invited here to be a shorthand for invited plus refused an offer to eat more.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.2.pli: Nimantite vematikā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.2.eng: If she has refused an offer, but she is unsure of it, and she eats fresh or cooked food, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.3.pli: Nimantite animantitasaññā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.3.eng: If she has refused an offer, but she does not perceive that she has, and she eats fresh or cooked food, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.4.pli: Yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ āhāratthāya paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.4.eng: If she receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.5.eng: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.5.comm: The Pali has ellipses points, which seems to be a mistake.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.7.eng: if she has refused an offer to eat more, but not an invitation;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.9.eng: if she eats more after getting permission from the person who invited her;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.10.pli: yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ sati paccaye paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.10.eng: if, when there is a reason, she uses post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.12.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.13.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:0.5.eng: The training rule on keeping families for oneself

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī sāvatthiyaṃ aññatarissā visikhāya piṇḍāya caramānā yena aññataraṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.2.eng: a certain nun there was walking for almsfood along a street. She then went to a certain family where she sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.3.pli: Atha kho te manussā taṃ bhikkhuniṃ bhojetvā etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.3.eng: The people there gave her a meal and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo nāgaccheyyun”ti, bhikkhuniyo upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.6.eng: “What can I do so that other nuns don’t come?” And she went up to other nuns and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.7.pli: “amukasmiṃ, ayye, okāse vāḷā sunakhā caṇḍo balibaddo cikkhallo okāso.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.7.eng: “Venerables, in such-and-such a place there are malicious dogs, a fierce ox, and it’s muddy.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.9.pli: Aññatarāpi bhikkhunī tassā visikhāya piṇḍāya caramānā yena taṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.9.eng: Another nun, too, went to that family while walking for almsfood along that street. She sat down on the prepared seat

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.10.pli: Atha kho te manussā taṃ bhikkhuniṃ bhojetvā etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.10.eng: and the people there gave her a meal. They then asked her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.11.eng: “Venerable, why don’t the nuns come here?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.12.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī tesaṃ manussānaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.12.eng: And she told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.14.eng: “How can a nun keep a family to herself?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.15.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun acted like this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.18.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī kulaṃ maccharāyissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.18.eng: “How could a nun act like this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.20.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.20.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:1.21.1.eng: ‘If a nun keeps a family to herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.1.6.pli: cattāri kulāni— khattiyakulaṃ, brāhmaṇakulaṃ, vessakulaṃ, suddakulaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.1.6.eng: there are four kinds of families: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.1.8.pli: “kathaṃ bhikkhuniyo nāgaccheyyun”ti bhikkhunīnaṃ santike kulassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.1.8.eng: if she thinks, “What can I do so that other nuns don’t come?” and she then speaks disparagingly about that family to the nuns, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.1.9.pli: Kulassa vā santike bhikkhunīnaṃ avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.1.9.eng: If she speaks disparagingly about that family to the nuns, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.2.2.pli: kulaṃ na maccharāyantī santaṃyeva ādīnavaṃ ācikkhati,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.2.2.eng: if she is not keeping a family to herself, but describes the drawbacks as they are;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc55:2.2.5.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:0.5.eng: The training rule on monasteries without monks

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhuniyo gāmakāvāse vassaṃvuṭṭhā sāvatthiṃ agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.2.eng: At that time a number of nuns who had completed the rainy-season residence in a village monastery went to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.4.eng: “Venerables, where did you spend the rains residence?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.5.eng: We hope the instruction was effective?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.7.eng: So how could the instruction be effective?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.8.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.8.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ vasissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.9.eng: “How could nuns spend the rains residence in a monastery without monks?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ vasantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ vasissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.15.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.16.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ vaseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a nun spends the rainy-season residence in a monastery without monks, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.6.pli: na sakkā hoti ovādāya vā saṃvāsāya vā gantuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.6.eng: she is not able to go to the instruction or to a formal meeting of the community.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.6.comm: According to Bu Pc 69:2.1.21 “community”, saṁvāsa, refers to formal meetings of the community. The present rule refers to formal meetings where both monks and nuns are present.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.7.pli: “Vassaṃ vasissāmī”ti senāsanaṃ paññapeti pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhapeti pariveṇaṃ sammajjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.7.eng: If she thinks, “I’ll stay here for the rainy-season residence,” and she prepares a dwelling, sets out water for drinking and water for washing, and sweeps the yard, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.7.comm: “Yard” renders pariveṇa. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.8.eng: At dawn, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.2.2.pli: vassupagatā bhikkhū pakkantā vā honti vibbhantā vā kālaṅkatā vā pakkhasaṅkantā vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.2.2.eng: if the monks who entered the rainy-season residence there depart or disrobe or die or join another group;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.2.2.comm: Sp 2.693 defines pakkhasaṅkantā as joining another religion: Pakkhasaṅkantā vāti titthāyatanaṁ saṅkantā, “Pakkhasaṅkantā vā means one who has joined the ascetics of another religion.” Yet the idea of pakkha also refers to groups or factions within the Sangha, for instance, when the Sangha is split into different communities (nānāsaṁvāsa) that no longer perform legal procedures together. As such, it is a term for a separate sect of Buddhism. For a discussion of the word vibbhantā, “disrobed”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.2.6.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:0.5.eng: The training rule on not inviting

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhuniyo gāmakāvāse vassaṃvuṭṭhā sāvatthiṃ agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.2.eng: At that time a number of nuns who had completed the rainy-season residence in a village monastery went to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.4.eng: “Venerables, where did you spend the rains residence?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.5.eng: Where did you invite the Sangha of monks for correction?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.6.eng: “We didn’t invite the Sangha of monks for correction.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo vassaṃvuṭṭhā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ na pavāressantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.8.eng: “How could nuns who have completed the rains residence not invite the Sangha of monks for correction?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo vassaṃvuṭṭhā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ na pavārentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns didn’t do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo vassaṃvuṭṭhā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ na pavāressanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.14.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.15.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī vassaṃvuṭṭhā ubhatosaṅghe tīhi ṭhānehi na pavāreyya diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a nun who has completed the rainy-season residence does not invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three things—what has been seen, heard, or suspected—she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.1.5.eng: Who has completed the rainy-season residence:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.1.6.pli: purimaṃ vā temāsaṃ pacchimaṃ vā temāsaṃ vuṭṭhā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.1.6.eng: who has completed the first three or the last three months of the rainy-season residence.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.1.7.pli: Ubhatosaṅghe tīhi ṭhānehi na pavāressāmi diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā”ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.1.7.eng: If she thinks, “I won’t invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three things—what has been seen, heard, or suspected,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.2.3.eng: if she searches, but does not find anyone to invite for correction;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.2.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc57:2.2.8.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.
